intro: Anthoshorea farinosa, commonly known as the farinose anthoshorea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
